definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
sow in spring, develop in summer, harvest in autumn, store in winter (idiom)
pinyin: chun1 sheng1 , xia4 zhang3 , qiu1 shou1 , dong1 cang2

sentences.english: This revolutionary historical novel centres in the Autumn Harvest Uprising.
sentences.chinese: 这部革命历史小说以秋收起义为中心内容。

sentences.english: SINCE time immemorial, farmers have planted their crops according to the seasons.
sentences.chinese: 史前时期，农民便懂得春种秋收。

sentences.english: Provideth her meat for herself in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
sentences.chinese: 但在夏天却知准备食粮，在秋收时积贮养料。

sentences.english: Autumn harvest is about to start and the Smiths are about to help us.
sentences.chinese: 秋收即将开始，史密斯一家很快就会过来帮助我们。

sentences.english: She secures food in summer and stores up provisions during harvest time.
sentences.chinese: 但在夏天却知准备食粮，在秋收时积贮养料。

sentences.english: Mr. Doherty and his family are engaged in autumn harvest on the farm.
sentences.chinese: 多尔蒂先生和他的家人目前正在农场忙于秋收。

sentences.english: The autumn harvest this year is better than that of last year.
I have a book relating to the Autumn Harvest Uprising.
sentences.chinese: 我有一本关于秋收起义的书。

sentences.english: " Up until the time of harvest, " red rice yellow water Polygonum hydropiper, with Lan Zhao pan back to the pond.
sentences.chinese: 待到秋收，“水蓼花红稻穗黄，使君兰棹泛回塘。”

sentences.english: Born in spring and summer, autumn.
After harvest we store the grain.
sentences.chinese: 秋收之后，我们把粮食储存起来。

definition: to plow a field in the spring
beginning of spring/the lunar New Year
